abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/FT53_V21A_AN6_FULL runtime.

FT53_V21A_AN6_FULL is for the full event range for 2012 and can be used both for RunB and RunC 2012 collision data. Databases for limited event ranges are also available under /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch (FT53_V21A_AN6 is for the event range of RunB and FT53_V21A_AN6_RUNC for the event range of RunC).

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

For 2012 CMS simulated datasets see:

title: Condition data for 2012 CMS collision data

abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/START53_V27 runtime.

START53_V27 is to be used with the simulated data.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

For 2012 CMS collision data see:

title: Condition data for 2012 CMS simulated datasets

abstract.description:
Condition database includes non-event-related information (Alignment, Calibration, Temperature, etc.) and parameters for simulation/reconstruction/analysis software.

These files are needed when running a CMSSW job on the open data environment (VM or container), and they are available in the /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch file system. They are automatically read from /cvmfs/cms-opendata-conddb.cern.ch/START53_V7N runtime.

START53_V7N was used to generate the simulated data used in the Higgs discovery analysis with dose-dependent detector characteristics, run-dependent pile-up and beam spot conditions.

These condition data are only needed for production of samples and not for analysis of the already available simulated data.

See further information in the guide to CMS condition database.

For 2012 CMS collision data see:

title: Condition data for 2012 run-dependent simulated data production
